subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}} – a man in a hat. Borrowed for abstract meanings. The derivative {{och-l|冕}} refers to the original word.

subSections.title: Pronunciation 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=miǎn
|c=min5
|h=pfs=miên
|md=miēng
|mn=bián
|mn-t=miang2/miêng2/ming2/mêng2
|mn-t_note=miang2/miêng2 - literary (including “there is no need”, miêng2 - Chaozhou); ming2/mêng2 - vernacular (mêng2 - Jieyang)
|w=3mi
|mc=y
|oc=y
|ma=Zh-mian.ogg
|cat=v,mn:adv
}}

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[take off]]; to [[remove]] from the [[body]]
# to [[release]]; to [[set free]]
# to [[excuse]] from; to [[exempt]]
# to [[discharge]]; to [[waive]]; to [[forgive]]
# to [[dismiss]] from [[office]]
# to be [[not]] [[allowed]]; to be [[forbidden]] to
# {{lb|zh|Min Nan}} it is not [[necessary]]; there is no need
